dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Tokayev's announcement to shut down Kaspi.kz is a huge deal, but I think a lot of people might assume it's just about breaking up a big company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Tokayev's announcement to shut down the website is a huge deal, but I think a lot of people might assume it's just about breaking up a big company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance of further assistance to small and medium-sized businesses in Kazakhstan and in this regard expressed his support to the shareholders of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's way more specific than that. The Ministry of Finance briefing revealed their tech was actually hindering small businesses, not helping them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's way more specific than that. The Ministry of Finance briefing revealed their tech was actually hindering small businesses, not helping them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President was updated on the results of Kaspi.kz and its plans to create new services to help develop small and medium-sized businesses in the country. According to the information presented to the Head of State, today about 700 thousand domestic entrepreneurs are developing their businesses using technologies from Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the numbers are pretty shocking. They claimed 700,000 entrepreneurs used it, but the real figure was only around 7,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the numbers are pretty shocking. They claimed seven hundred thousand entrepreneurs used it, but the real figure was only around seven thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the information presented to the Head of State, today about 700 thousand domestic entrepreneurs are developing their businesses using technologies from Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And most of those 7,000 were apparently unhappy with the fees and restrictions, which is uh, not a great look for a platform that's supposed to be enabling growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And most of those seven thousand were apparently unhappy with the fees and restrictions, which is uh, not a great look for a platform that's supposed to be enabling growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then you have the transaction data—only 120 billion tenge in non-cash payments in six months, which is, like, way lower than what was being projected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then you have the transaction data-only one hundred twenty billion tenge in non-cash payments in six months, which is, like, way lower than what was being projected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the new business registrations were abysmal, only 1,500 individual entrepreneurs in that period. That drop is being directly blamed on Kaspi.kz's policies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the new business registrations were abysmal, only fifteen hundred individual entrepreneurs in that period. That drop is being directly blamed on the website 's policies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Then there's the whole tax payment system scandal. It was supposed to be this collaborative effort, but they found widespread fraud.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then there's the whole tax payment system scandal. It was supposed to be this collaborative effort, but they found widespread fraud.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis can pay taxes on time using online services created jointly between Kaspi.kz and the relevant government departments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: A mere 11 billion tenge in taxes processed, and most payments never even went through? That's a complete failure of the system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A mere eleven billion tenge in taxes processed, and most payments never even went through? That's a complete failure of the system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the first 6 months of 2024, more than 1.1 trillion tenge in taxes and other payments to the budget were made in this way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the President didn't hold back, directly calling out the shareholders, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze, for their involvement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the President didn't hold back, directly calling out the shareholders, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze, for their involvement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance of further assistance to small and medium-sized businesses in Kazakhstan and in this regard expressed his support to the shareholders of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is significant because they've been tied to corruption before, so this feels like a final straw moment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is significant because they've been tied to corruption before, so this feels like a final straw moment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really does signal a much bigger push for transparency and actual competition, not just talk about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does signal a much bigger push for transparency and actual competition, not just talk about it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. This is a major policy shift aimed at rebuilding trust in the ground up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. This is a major policy shift aimed at rebuilding trust in the ground up.

artist_script:
President Tokayev's announcement to shut down Kaspi.kz is a huge deal, but I think a lot of people might assume it's just about breaking up a big company.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s way more specific than that. The Ministry of Finance briefing revealed their tech was actually hindering small businesses, not helping them.
HostA: Right, the numbers are pretty shocking. They claimed 700,000 entrepreneurs used it, but the real figure was only around 7,000.
HostB: And most of those 7,000 were apparently unhappy with the fees and restrictions, which is uh, not a great look for a platform that’s supposed to be enabling growth.
HostA: Exactly. And then you have the transaction data—only 120 billion tenge in non-cash payments in six months, which is, like, way lower than what was being projected.
HostB: And the new business registrations were abysmal, only 1,500 individual entrepreneurs in that period. That drop is being directly blamed on Kaspi.kz's policies.
HostA: Then there's the whole tax payment system scandal. It was supposed to be this collaborative effort, but they found widespread fraud.
HostB: A mere 11 billion tenge in taxes processed, and most payments never even went through? That’s a complete failure of the system.
HostA: And the President didn’t hold back, directly calling out the shareholders, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze, for their involvement.
HostB: Which is significant because they’ve been tied to corruption before, so this feels like a final straw moment.
HostA: It really does signal a much bigger push for transparency and actual competition, not just talk about it.
HostB: For sure. This is a major policy shift aimed at rebuilding trust in the ground up.
